content: ALCON, I have a Relief for Cause issue; the charge is "Perception of Favoritism". No UCMJ imposed; all actions were administrative. JAG says the inquiry that produced the results were "crackerjack" and "should have not been substantiated" but have no authority (cannot assist) becuase UCMJ was imposed. Who can offer an avenue of approach?
reply: ALCON, I have a Relief for Cause issue; the charge is "Perception of Favoritism". No UCMJ imposed; all actions were administrative. JAG says the inquiry that produced the results were "crackerjack" and "should have not been substantiated" but have no authority (cannot assist) becuase UCMJ was imposed. Who can offer an avenue of approach?
title: No UCMJ Help

content: You may find answers at “ARMYSTUDYGUIDE.COM” key word search would be Relief for Cause of course. Or, ArmyNCO.com. Also, make appt to see your CSM and ask his/her advice. Break glass…in case of Emergency! Or, just wait till I get to the bottom of the bottle!

content: Three steps: The chain of command Civilian attorney Move on with you life It would have make it easier to answer the post if with knew your grade, time in service, position that you were removed from. A listening ear, a caring heart, an open mind and an extend hand may be all I can offer, but they are yours without charge or judgment.
reply: Three steps: The chain of command Civilian attorney Move on with you life It would have make it easier to answer the post if with knew your grade, time in service, position that you were removed from. A listening ear, a caring heart, an open mind and an extend hand may be all I can offer, but they are yours without charge or judgment.

content: quote: Originally posted by afghanman: ALCON, I have a Relief for Cause issue; the charge is "Perception of Favoritism". No UCMJ imposed; all actions were administrative. JAG says the inquiry that produced the results were "crackerjack" and "should have not been substantiated" but have no authority (cannot assist) becuase UCMJ was imposed. Who can offer an avenue of approach? If you signed something, you probably bought the farm. Probably should have run a bluff, hope to draw to an inside straight, and demanded a "Special Courts Martial". That would have forced people to produce real evidence in front of a judge, who probably would have given a real droll look, unless you WERE showing favoritism to someone - especially for favors back - In most cases, if the evidence is thin, and you demand a Special Court, the Article 15 gets trashed - if your innocence or their BS is obvious. But if your bluff is called, you get the Court and are found guilty, then you're goose is really cooked - - Wandering and Wondering

JAG says the inquiry that produced the results were "crackerjack" and "should have not been substantiated" but have no authority (cannot assist) becuase UCMJ was imposed. Who can offer an avenue of approach?
reply: If you signed something, you probably bought the farm. Probably should have run a bluff, hope to draw to an inside straight, and demanded a "Special Courts Martial". That would have forced people to produce real evidence in front of a judge, who probably would have given a real droll look, unless you WERE showing favoritism to someone - especially for favors back - In most cases, if the evidence is thin, and you demand a Special Court, the Article 15 gets trashed - if your innocence or their BS is obvious. But if your bluff is called, you get the Court and are found guilty, then you're goose is really cooked - - Wandering and Wondering
